text: Eucutta Creek is a stream in the U.S. state of Mississippi. It is a tributary to the Chickasawhay River.Eucutta is a name derived from the Choctaw language, most likely meaning "large pond". In 2014, a pipeline near Eucutta sprung a leak, discharging about 50 barrels of oil and 40 barrels of brine into the Eucutta creek. Many Wayne County environmental agencies have cleaned up the spill since then. ==References== Category:Rivers of Mississippi Category:Bodies of water of Clarke County, Mississippi Category:Bodies of water of Jasper County, Mississippi Category:Bodies of water of Wayne County, Mississippi
title: Eucutta Creek
